page.title: 03HOMES IN WALESBY
page.content: Walesby has a population of around 1200, having more than doubled in size of the last 20 years. There have been many new housing developments during this time, mainly private housing with one local authority housing estate on the site of the former Manor House. As a result of this building the village has a cross-section of homes, indeed the approximate figures are: Semi-det. bungalows - 12% Semi-det. houses - 39% Detached bungalows - 27% Detached houses - 22% Despite the amount of new building there are still a number of homes over 100 years old, particularly in the area around the Church on Main Street. There is very little stone work, most of the houses are brick built.
